sections.heading: Demonstratives (これ、それ、あれ)
sections.content:
Demonstratives are words that point to things, meaning "this," "that," "this one," "that one." Japanese has three main demonstratives based on distance: これ (this), それ (that), and あれ (that over there). They form part of the ko-so-a-do system.

これは本です "This is a book" (near speaker) それは何ですか "What is that?" (near listener) あれは学校です "That over there is a school" (far from both)

children.heading: これ (kore) - This
children.content: これは何ですか "What is this?" これください "This one, please" Near speaker Within reach Close proximity

children.heading: それ (sore) - That
children.content: それは何ですか "What is that?" それをください "That one, please" Near listener Medium distance Close to you (listener)

children.heading: あれ (are) - That over there
children.content: あれは何ですか "What is that over there?" あれを見て "Look at that" Far from both Distant from speaker and listener Over there

children.heading: これ - Near me
children.content: In my hand On my desk Right here Within my reach Close to speaker

children.heading: それ - Near you
children.content: In your hand On your desk Near listener You can reach it Close to listener

children.heading: あれ - Far away
children.content: Across the room Outside Not near either person Pointing at distance Away from both

children.heading: Asking "What is this/that?"
children.content: これは何ですか "What is this?" それは何ですか "What is that?" あれは何ですか "What is that over there?" Common question pattern

children.heading: Identifying things
children.content: これは本です "This is a book" それはペンです "That is a pen" あれは富士山です "That over there is Mt. Fuji" Identification

children.heading: Standing alone
children.content: これ、それ、あれ are pronouns Stand alone as subjects/objects Don't modify nouns directly これがいい "This one is good" それを買う "Buy that one"

children.heading: With particles
children.content: これは "this (topic)" それが "that (subject)" あれを "that over there (object)" これの "of this" Work with all particles

sections.heading: これ/それ/あれ vs この/その/あの

children.heading: これ/それ/あれ = Pronouns (stand alone)
children.content: これは本です "This is a book" これを買う "Buy this" Stand-alone words Act as nouns

children.heading: この/その/あの = Modifiers (before nouns)
children.content: この本 "This book" その人 "That person" あの山 "That mountain over there" Modify nouns Come before nouns

children.heading: これは〜です (This is...)
children.content: これは私の本です "This is my book" これは高いです "This is expensive" Identification pattern

children.heading: これをください (This one, please)
children.content: これをください "This one, please" それをください "That one, please" Shopping phrase

children.heading: これでいい (This is fine)
children.content: これでいいです "This is fine" それでいい？ "Is that okay?" Acceptance pattern

children.heading: Physical objects
children.content: これ見て "Look at this" それ取って "Pass me that" あれ何？ "What's that over there?" Physical reference

children.heading: Referring to situations/ideas
children.content: それはいい考えだ "That's a good idea" これは難しい問題だ "This is a difficult problem" Not physical objects Concepts, situations

children.heading: この/その/あの件 (this/that matter)
children.content: その件について "About that matter" あの件は解決した "That matter was resolved" Referring to situations

children.heading: Connector meaning
children.content: 雨が降った。それで家にいた。 "It rained. So I stayed home." それで？ "And then? / So?" Transition word Different from "that"

children.heading: Temporal demonstratives
children.content: この前 "the other day/before" その時 "at that time" あの時 "at that time (past)" Time periods Not physical distance

children.heading: どれ (dore) - Which one
children.content: どれがいいですか "Which one is good?" どれを買う？ "Which will you buy?" Question form Asking for selection

children.heading: これら/それら/あれら (These/Those)
children.content: これらは私のです "These are mine" それらは高い "Those are expensive" Plural demonstratives Formal/written

children.heading: Natural dialogue
children.content: A: これは何？ "What's this?" B: それは辞書だよ "That's a dictionary" Speaker's これ = listener's それ Perspective shift

children.heading: これでいい pattern
children.content: これでいい？ "Is this okay?" それでいいです "That's fine" Acceptance/approval Common phrase

children.heading: Using これ/それ/あれ before nouns
children.content: Wrong: これ本 ⚠️ Correct: この本 ✓ "This book" Wrong: それ人 ⚠️ Correct: その人 ✓ "That person" Use この/その/あの before nouns

children.heading: Confusing それ and あれ
children.content: それ: Near listener "That (near you)" あれ: Far from both "That over there" Distance matters

children.heading: Pointing at items
children.content: これをください "This one, please" (near you/clerk) あれを見せてください "Please show me that one" (far away) それはいくらですか "How much is that?" (near clerk) Common shopping phrases

children.heading: Basic
children.content: これは何ですか "What is this?" それはペンです "That is a pen" あれは富士山です "That over there is Mt. Fuji" これをください "This one, please" どれがいいですか "Which one is good?"

children.heading: Intermediate
children.content: A: これは何ですか。 B: それは日本語の辞書です。 A: "What is this?" B: "That's a Japanese dictionary." これとそれ、どちらがいいですか。 "Which is better, this or that?" あれを見てください。あれが 私の学校です。 "Please look at that. That over there is my school." この本とその本はどう違いますか。 これは簡単で、それは難しいです。 "How do this book and that book differ? This one is easy, and that one is difficult."
